title: Rain on Your Parade
description: To spoil someone's fun or plans; ruining a pleasurable moment

title: Son of a Gun
description: A person, usually one who is behaving badly.

title: You Can't Teach an Old Dog New Tricks
description: It can be challenging to teach a person something new.

title: High And Dry
description: To be left behind; abandoned. Being in a helpless situation without a way to recover.

title: Talk the Talk
description: Supporting what you say, not just with words, but also through action or evidence.

title: What Goes Up Must Come Down
description: Things that go up must eventually return to the earth due to gravity.

title: It's Not All It's Cracked Up To Be
description: Failing to meet expectations; not being as good as people say.

title: Fight Fire With Fire
description: To retaliate with an attack that is similar to the attack used against you.

title: Two Down, One to Go
description: Two things have been completed, but there is one more that has yet to be finished.

title: Ride Him, Cowboy!
description: A cheer people yell, usually at rodeos when cowboys are clinging to the backs of untamed horses.

title: Beating Around the Bush
description: Someone who is beating around the bush is someone who avoids the main point.

title: Short End of the Stick
description: Getting the bad end of a deal, or receiving the least desirable outcome from something.

title: Goody Two-Shoes
description: A smugly virtuous person.

title: Yada Yada
description: A way to notify a person that what they're saying is predictable or boring.

title: A Bite at the Cherry
description: An opportunity that's not available to most people.

title: Happy as a Clam
description: The state of being happy; feeling delighted.

title: Mouth-watering
description: Delicious; something that looks or tastes appetizing.

title: If You Can't Stand the Heat, Get Out of the Kitchen
description: One should discontinue with a task if they are unable to cope with it due to pressure.

title: Greased Lightning
description: Very fast or quick.

title: Under the Weather
description: Not feeling well, in health or mood.

title: Lickety Split
description: To go at a quick pace; no delaying!

title: Elvis Has Left The Building
description: Something that is all over.

title: Top Drawer
description: High quality, exceptional; something that's very valuable.

title: Birds of a Feather Flock Together
description: People tend to associate with others who share similar interests or values.

title: My Cup of Tea
description: Someone or something that one finds to be agreeable or delightful.

title: Let Her Rip
description: Permission to start, or it could mean 'go faster!'

title: Par For the Course
description: What you would expect to happen; something normal or common.

title: A Guinea Pig
description: Someone who is used in an experiment.

title: A Few Sandwiches Short of a Picnic
description: Someone who's not intelligent or has questionable mental capacity.

title: Every Cloud Has a Silver Lining
description: To be optimistic, even in difficullt times.

title: Like Father Like Son
description: Resembling one's parents in terms of appearance or behavior.

title: Drive Me Nuts
description: To greatly frustrate someone. To drive someone crazy, insane, bonkers, or bananas.

title: It's Not Brain Surgery
description: A task that's easy to accomplish, a thing lacking complexity.

title: Cup Of Joe
description: A cup of joe is an American nickname for a cup of coffee.

title: Scot-free
description: Getting away freely from custody, punishment, or any type of risky situation.

title: Wouldn't Harm a Fly
description: Nonviolent; someone who is mild or gentle.

title: I Smell a Rat
description: A feeling that something is not quite right, or awry.

title: Down And Out
description: (1) A term used in a boxing. (2) Someone who has become incapacitated.

title: Quick On the Draw
description: Performing an action with the greatest of haste.

title: Love Birds
description: A pair of people who have a shared love for each other.

title: On the Ropes
description: Being in a situation that looks to be hopeless!

title: A Lone Wolf
description: Someone who's solitary or independent.

title: Jaws of Death
description: Being in a dangerous or very deadly situation.

title: A Cat Nap
description: A short slumber taken during the day.

title: Down To The Wire
description: A tense situation where the outcome is decided only in the last few seconds.

title: Flea Market
description: A type of bazaar where inexpensive goods are sold or bartered.

title: Ring Any Bells?
description: Recalling a memory; causing a person to remember something or someone.

title: A Day Late and a Dollar Short
description: Too late. A missed opportunity.

title: A Cold Fish
description: Someone who lacks empathy and emotion.

title: Hit Below The Belt
description: A boxing term. Also often used to refer to inappropriate words, or comments that are too personal.

title: Curiosity Killed The Cat
description: Typically said to indicate that any further investigation into a situation may lead to harm.

title: On Cloud Nine
description: Having strong feelings of happiness or satisfaction.

title: A Dog in the Manger
description: Someone who prevents others from using valuable items even though they have no need for them.

title: A Cold Day in July
description: Something that is highly unlikely to happen.

title: A Dime a Dozen
description: Something that is extremely common.

title: What Goes Up Must Come Down
description: Things that go up must eventually return to the earth due to gravity.

title: Rain on Your Parade
description: To spoil someone's fun or plans; ruining a pleasurable moment

title: Two Down, One to Go
description: Two things have been completed, but there is one more that has yet to be finished.

title: Happy as a Clam
description: The state of being happy; feeling delighted.

title: Down For The Count
description: Someone or something that looks to be defeated, or nearly so.

title: Give a Man a Fish
description: It's better to teach a person how to do something than to do that something for them.

title: Playing Possum
description: Pretending to be dead, or to be deceitful about something.

title: A Little from Column A, a Little from Column B
description: A course of action drawing a couple of different factors or reasons.

title: Lovey Dovey
description: The affectionate stuff that people do when they are in love, such as kissing and hugging.

title: All Greek To Me
description: When something is incomprehensible due to complexity; unintelligble.

title: A Piece of Cake
description: A task that is simple to accomplish.

title: Heads Up
description: Used as an advanced warning. To become keenly aware.

title: Long In The Tooth
description: Old in age. Mainly used when referring to people or horses.

title: Break The Ice
description: Breaking down a social stiffness.

title: Back To the Drawing Board
description: Starting over again on a new design from a previously failed attempt.

title: Talk the Talk
description: Supporting what you say, not just with words, but also through action or evidence.

title: Everything But The Kitchen Sink
description: Including nearly everything possible.

title: Jig Is Up
description: For a ruse or trick to be discovered; to be caught.

title: Raining Cats and Dogs
description: When it is raining heavily.

title: You Can't Teach an Old Dog New Tricks
description: It can be challenging to teach a person something new.

title: Man of Few Words
description: A person who does not speak a great deal; someone who talks with as few words as possible.

title: Go Out On a Limb
description: Putting yourself in a risky situation in order to help someone; or to hazard a guess.

title: A Little Bird Told Me
description: Used when you don't wish to divulge where you got the information.

title: A Lone Wolf
description: Someone who's solitary or independent.

title: Under Your Nose
description: Missing something that should be really obvious.

title: Eat My Hat
description: Having confidence in a specific outcome; being almost sure about something.

title: Ugly Duckling
description: One who may seem plain at first in appearance or capability, but later turns out to be beautiful or great.

title: Right Out of the Gate
description: Right from the beginning; to do something from the start.

title: Every Cloud Has a Silver Lining
description: To be optimistic, even in difficullt times.

title: Quick and Dirty
description: Things that are fixed with great speed, but as a result, it's probably not going to work very well.

title: Goody Two-Shoes
description: A smugly virtuous person.

title: Head Over Heels
description: Falling deeply in love with another person.

title: A Lemon
description: Usually a vehicle (but any device) that you buy that's defective.

title: Wouldn't Harm a Fly
description: Nonviolent; someone who is mild or gentle.

title: Mouth-watering
description: Delicious; something that looks or tastes appetizing.

title: Playing For Keeps
description: Said when things are about to get serious.

title: No Ifs, Ands, or Buts
description: Finishing a task without making any excuses.

title: Right Off the Bat
description: Immediately, done in a hurry; without delay.

title: Shot In the Dark
description: An attempt that has little chance for success.

title: A Busy Bee
description: An industrious person.

title: It's Not All It's Cracked Up To Be
description: Failing to meet expectations; not being as good as people say.

title: A Home Bird
description: Somebody who prefers the comforts of home to new places or things.

title: A Cut Below
description: Something that's inferior to the surrounding others.

title: Throw In the Towel
description: Giving up; to surrender.

title: Foaming At The Mouth
description: To be enraged and show it.
